comments:
When I start eclipse for the first time there is the following log.
I used Windows XP Pro. 

!SESSION 2006-01-22 14:08:06.781 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=M20050929-0840
java.version=1.5.0_05
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=fr_FR
Framework arguments:  eclipse
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 eclipse

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2006-01-22 14:08:07.968
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service.
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:367)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:163)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:278)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:973)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)
Is there a .log file in the configuration folder of your install that you could post here?
Yes I give you the .log file in the configuration folder of my install.
Make sure that the archive you are installing eclipse from is not corrupted and/or that the unzipping succeeded.
In another bug report, the author of the bug indicate that its eclipse archive was corrupted. Closing.
